burlap.oomdp.singleagent.explorer

Class VisualExplorer

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Window
          • java.awt.Frame
            • javax.swing.JFrame
              • burlap.oomdp.singleagent.explorer.VisualExplorer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants

    public class VisualExplorer
extends javax.swing.JFrame
    This class allows you act as the agent by choosing actions in an Environment. States are conveyed to the user through a 2D visualization and the user specifies actions by either pressing keys that are mapped to actions or by typing the actions into the action command field. Action parameters in the action field are specified by space delineated input. For instance: "stack block0 block1" will cause the stack action to called with action parameters block0 and block1. The ` key causes the state to reset to the initial state provided to the explorer or to a state that is sampled from a provided StateGenerator object. Other special kinds of actions not described in the domain can be added and executed by pressing corresponding keys for them. The episodes of action taken by a user may also be recorded to a list of recorded episodes and then subsequently polled by a client object. To enable episode recording, use the method enableEpisodeRecording(String, String). To check if the user is still recording episodes, use the method isRecording(). To retrieve the recorded episodes, use the method getRecordedEpisodes().
    Author:
    James MacGlashan
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • VisualExplorer

        public VisualExplorer(Domain domain,
              Visualizer painter,
              State baseState)
        Initializes with a domain and initial state, automatically creating a SimulatedEnvironment as the environment with which to interact. The created SimulatedEnvironment will have a NullRewardFunction and NullTermination functions set.
        Parameters:
        domain - the domain to explore
        painter - the 2D state visualizer
        baseState - the initial state from which to explore

      • addKeyAction

        public void addKeyAction(java.lang.String key,
                java.lang.String actionStringRep)
        Specifies a string representation of an action to execute when the specified key is pressed. The string representation should have the first word be the action name, with spaces separating the parameters of the string representation of each parameter value.
        Parameters:
        key - the key that is pressed by the user
        actionStringRep - the GroundedAction to take when the key is pressed

        action - the GroundedAction to take when the key is pressed

      • enableEpisodeRecording

        public void enableEpisodeRecording(java.lang.String recordLastEpisodeKey,
                          java.lang.String finishedRecordingKey)
        Enables episodes recording of actions taken. Whenever the recordLastEpisodeKey is pressed, the episode starting from the initial state, or last state reset (activated with the ` key) up until the current state is stored in a list of recorded episodes. When the finishedRecordingKey is pressed, the isRecording() flag is set to false to let any client objects know that the list of recorded episodes can be safely polled. The list of recorded episodes can be polled using the method getRecordedEpisodes().
        Parameters:
        recordLastEpisodeKey - the key to press to indicate that the last episode should be recorded/saved.
        finishedRecordingKey - the key to press to indicate that no more episodes will be recorded so that the list of recorded episodes can be safely polled by a client object.

      • enableEpisodeRecording

        public void enableEpisodeRecording(java.lang.String recordLastEpisodeKey,
                          java.lang.String finishedRecordingKey,
                          java.lang.String saveDirectory)
        Enables episodes recording of actions taken. Whenever the recordLastEpisodeKey is pressed, the episode starting from the initial state, or last state reset (activated with the ` key) up until the current state is stored in a list of recorded episodes. When the finishedRecordingKey is pressed, the isRecording() flag is set to false to let any client objects know that the list of recorded episodes can be safely polled. The list of recorded episodes is saved to disk in the directory saveDirectory. States will be serialized with SimpleSerializableStateFactory The list of recorded episodes can be polled using the method getRecordedEpisodes().
        Parameters:
        recordLastEpisodeKey - the key to press to indicate that the last episode should be recorded/saved.
        finishedRecordingKey - the key to press to indicate that no more episodes will be recorded so that the list of recorded episodes can be safely polled by a client object.
        saveDirectory - the directory in which all episodes will be saved

      • enableEpisodeRecording

        public void enableEpisodeRecording(java.lang.String recordLastEpisodeKey,
                          java.lang.String finishedRecordingKey,
                          java.lang.String saveDirectory,
                          SerializableStateFactory serializableStateFactory)
        Enables episodes recording of actions taken. Whenever the recordLastEpisodeKey is pressed, the episode starting from the initial state, or last state reset (activated with the ` key) up until the current state is stored in a list of recorded episodes. When the finishedRecordingKey is pressed, the isRecording() flag is set to false to let any client objects know that the list of recorded episodes can be safely polled. The list of recorded episodes is saved to disk in the directory saveDirectory. The list of recorded episodes can be polled using the method getRecordedEpisodes().
        Parameters:
        recordLastEpisodeKey - the key to press to indicate that the last episode should be recorded/saved.
        finishedRecordingKey - the key to press to indicate that no more episodes will be recorded so that the list of recorded episodes can be safely polled by a client object.
        saveDirectory - the directory in which all episodes will be saved
        serializableStateFactory - the SerializableStateFactory to use for serializing states

      • isRecording

        public boolean isRecording()
        Returns whether episodes are still be recorded by a user.
        Returns:
        true is the user is still recording episode; false otherwise.

      • getRecordedEpisodes

        Returns the list of episodes recorded by a user.
        Returns:
        the list of episodes recorded by a user.

      • startLiveStatePolling

        public void startLiveStatePolling(long msPollDelay)
        Starts a thread that polls this explorer's Environment every msPollDelay milliseconds for its current state and updates the visualizer to that state. Polling can be stopped with the stopLivePolling().
        Parameters:
        msPollDelay - the number of milliseconds between environment polls and state updates.

      • stopLivePolling

        public void stopLivePolling()
        Stops this class from live polling this explorer's Environment.
